name: CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr_hom
initialProofState:
V : Type u'
inst‚úù¬≥ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v', u'} V
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategory V
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.EnrichedOrdinaryCategory V C
X Y X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ : C
Œ± : CategoryTheory.Iso X X‚ÇÅ
Œ≤ : CategoryTheory.Iso Y Y‚ÇÅ
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≤).hom (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.eHomWhiskerRight V Œ±.inv Y) (CategoryTheory.eHomWhiskerLeft V X‚ÇÅ Œ≤.hom))
decl:
/-- Given isomorphisms `Œ± : X ‚âÖ X‚ÇÅ` and `Œ≤ : Y ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÅ` in `C`, we can construct
an isomorphism between `V` objects `X ‚ü∂[V] Y` and `X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂[V] Y‚ÇÅ`. -/
@[simps]
def eHomCongr {X Y X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ : C} (Œ± : X ‚âÖ X‚ÇÅ) (Œ≤ : Y ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÅ) :
    (X ‚ü∂[V] Y) ‚âÖ (X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂[V] Y‚ÇÅ) where
  hom := eHomWhiskerRight V Œ±.inv Y ‚â´ eHomWhiskerLeft V X‚ÇÅ Œ≤.hom
  inv := eHomWhiskerRight V Œ±.hom Y‚ÇÅ ‚â´ eHomWhiskerLeft V X Œ≤.inv
  hom_inv_id := by
    rw [‚Üê eHom_whisker_exchange]
    slice_lhs 2 3 => rw [‚Üê eHomWhiskerRight_comp]
    simp [‚Üê eHomWhiskerLeft_comp]
  inv_hom_id := by
    rw [‚Üê eHom_whisker_exchange]
    slice_lhs 2 3 => rw [‚Üê eHomWhiskerRight_comp]
    simp [‚Üê eHomWhiskerLeft_comp]

decl:
lemma eHomCongr_refl (X Y : C) :
    eHomCongr V (Iso.refl X) (Iso.refl Y) = Iso.refl (X ‚ü∂[V] Y) := by aesop

name: CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr_trans
initialProofState:
V : Type u'
inst‚úù¬≥ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v', u'} V
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategory V
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.EnrichedOrdinaryCategory V C
X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ X‚ÇÇ Y‚ÇÇ X‚ÇÉ Y‚ÇÉ : C
Œ±‚ÇÅ : CategoryTheory.Iso X‚ÇÅ X‚ÇÇ
Œ≤‚ÇÅ : CategoryTheory.Iso Y‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÇ
Œ±‚ÇÇ : CategoryTheory.Iso X‚ÇÇ X‚ÇÉ
Œ≤‚ÇÇ : CategoryTheory.Iso Y‚ÇÇ Y‚ÇÉ
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V (Œ±‚ÇÅ.trans Œ±‚ÇÇ) (Œ≤‚ÇÅ.trans Œ≤‚ÇÇ)) ((CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ±‚ÇÅ Œ≤‚ÇÅ).trans (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ±‚ÇÇ Œ≤‚ÇÇ))
decl:
lemma eHomCongr_trans {X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ X‚ÇÇ Y‚ÇÇ X‚ÇÉ Y‚ÇÉ : C} (Œ±‚ÇÅ : X‚ÇÅ ‚âÖ X‚ÇÇ) (Œ≤‚ÇÅ : Y‚ÇÅ ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÇ)
    (Œ±‚ÇÇ : X‚ÇÇ ‚âÖ X‚ÇÉ) (Œ≤‚ÇÇ : Y‚ÇÇ ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÉ) :
    eHomCongr V (Œ±‚ÇÅ ‚â™‚â´ Œ±‚ÇÇ) (Œ≤‚ÇÅ ‚â™‚â´ Œ≤‚ÇÇ) =
      eHomCongr V Œ±‚ÇÅ Œ≤‚ÇÅ ‚â™‚â´ eHomCongr V Œ±‚ÇÇ Œ≤‚ÇÇ := by
  ext; simp [eHom_whisker_exchange_assoc]

name: CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr_comp_assoc
initialProofState:
V : Type u'
inst‚úù¬≥ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v', u'} V
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategory V
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.EnrichedOrdinaryCategory V C
X Y Z‚úù X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ : C
Œ± : CategoryTheory.Iso X X‚ÇÅ
Œ≤ : CategoryTheory.Iso Y Y‚ÇÅ
Œ≥ : CategoryTheory.Iso Z‚úù Z‚ÇÅ
f : Quiver.Hom X Y
g : Quiver.Hom Y Z‚úù
Z : V
h : Quiver.Hom (CategoryTheory.EnrichedCategory.Hom X‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ) Z
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp f g)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≥).hom h)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.leftUnitor CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.tensorUnit).inv (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.whiskerRight (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) f) (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≤).hom) CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.tensorUnit) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.whiskerLeft (CategoryTheory.EnrichedCategory.Hom X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) g) (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ≤ Œ≥).hom)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.eComp V X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ) h))))
decl:
/-- `eHomCongr` respects composition of morphisms. Recall that for any
composable pair of arrows `f : X ‚ü∂ Y` and `g : Y ‚ü∂ Z` in `C`, the composite
`f ‚â´ g` in `C` defines a morphism `ùüô_ V ‚ü∂ (X ‚ü∂[V] Z)` in `V`. Composing with
the isomorphism `eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≥` yields a morphism in `V` that can be factored
through the enriched composition map as shown:
`ùüô_ V ‚ü∂ ùüô_ V ‚äó ùüô_ V ‚ü∂ (X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂[V] Y‚ÇÅ) ‚äó (Y‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂[V] Z‚ÇÅ) ‚ü∂ (X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂[V] Z‚ÇÅ)`. -/
@[reassoc]
lemma eHomCongr_comp {X Y Z X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ : C} (Œ± : X ‚âÖ X‚ÇÅ) (Œ≤ : Y ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÅ) (Œ≥ : Z ‚âÖ Z‚ÇÅ)
    (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (g : Y ‚ü∂ Z) :
    eHomEquiv V (f ‚â´ g) ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≥).hom =
      (Œª_ _).inv ‚â´ (eHomEquiv V f ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≤).hom) ‚ñ∑ _ ‚â´
        _ ‚óÅ (eHomEquiv V g ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ≤ Œ≥).hom) ‚â´ eComp V X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ := by
  simp only [eHomCongr, MonoidalCategory.whiskerRight_id, assoc,
    MonoidalCategory.whiskerLeft_comp]
  rw [rightUnitor_inv_naturality_assoc, rightUnitor_inv_naturality_assoc,
    rightUnitor_inv_naturality_assoc, hom_inv_id_assoc, ‚Üê whisker_exchange_assoc,
    ‚Üê whisker_exchange_assoc, ‚Üê eComp_eHomWhiskerLeft, eHom_whisker_cancel_assoc,
    ‚Üê eComp_eHomWhiskerRight_assoc, ‚Üê tensorHom_def_assoc,
    ‚Üê eHomEquiv_comp_assoc]

        _ ‚óÅ (eHomEquiv V g ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ≤ Œ≥).hom) ‚â´ eComp V X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ := by

‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp f g)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≥).inv h)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.leftUnitor CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.tensorUnit).inv (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.whiskerRight (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) f) (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≤).inv) CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.tensorUnit) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.MonoidalCategoryStruct.whiskerLeft (CategoryTheory.EnrichedCategory.Hom X Y) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp ((CategoryTheory.eHomEquiv V) g) (CategoryTheory.Iso.eHomCongr V Œ≤ Œ≥).inv)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.eComp V X Y Z‚úù) h))))
decl:
/-- The inverse map defined by `eHomCongr` respects composition of morphisms. -/
@[reassoc]
lemma eHomCongr_inv_comp {X Y Z X‚ÇÅ Y‚ÇÅ Z‚ÇÅ : C} (Œ± : X ‚âÖ X‚ÇÅ) (Œ≤ : Y ‚âÖ Y‚ÇÅ)
    (Œ≥ : Z ‚âÖ Z‚ÇÅ) (f : X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂ Y‚ÇÅ) (g : Y‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ) :
    eHomEquiv V (f ‚â´ g) ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≥).inv =
      (Œª_ _).inv ‚â´ (eHomEquiv V f ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ± Œ≤).inv) ‚ñ∑ _ ‚â´
        _ ‚óÅ (eHomEquiv V g ‚â´ (eHomCongr V Œ≤ Œ≥).inv) ‚â´ eComp V X Y Z :=
  eHomCongr_comp V Œ±.symm Œ≤.symm Œ≥.symm f g
